sect1.title: Usage
sect1.para: The class vtkInteractorStyleJoystickActor allows the user to interact with (rotate, zoom, etc.) separate objects in the scene independent of each other. The position of the mouse relative to the center of the object determines the speed of the object's motion. The mouse's velocity detemines the acceleration of the object's motion, so the object will continue moving even when the mouse is not moving. For a 3-button mouse, the left button is for rotation, the right button for zooming, the middle button for panning, and ctrl + left button for spinning. (With fewer mouse buttons, ctrl + shift + left button is for zooming, and shift + left button is for panning.)
To create an instance of class vtkInteractorStyleJoystickActor, simply invoke its constructor as follows obj = vtkInteractorStyleJoystickActor
